definition: remote/hidden away/secluded/serene/peaceful/to imprison/in superstition indicates the underworld/ancient district spanning Liaonang and Hebei provinces
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: I want to smell the roses.
sentences.chinese: 我想要闻闻玫瑰的幽香。

sentences.english: A cloth had been spread over a little round table on which was a vase of fragrant plum blossom.
sentences.chinese: 小圆桌铺上了台布，添了瓶盛开的腊梅，吐着幽香。

sentences.english: Notes of dried figs, vanilla and dried flowers appear.
sentences.chinese: 回味中蕴含干无花果，香草及干花的幽香。

sentences.english: An off white to pale yellow free-flowing powder, with tangy citrus taste.
sentences.chinese: 米黄色自活动粉沫，带有幽香扑鼻的柑橘滋味。

sentences.english: Much older the wine, much more delicate fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 有年份的红酒，更显幽香。

sentences.english: With the breeze the breeze, then distributed at the core delicate hint of fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 随着晚风的轻拂，那纤弱的蕊上散发着淡淡的幽香。

sentences.english: When she just about fall over, a waft of fragrance makes her stop.
sentences.chinese: 在她差点跌倒时，一股幽香让她停下脚步。

sentences.english: And build thy perfumed ambers up his hive.
sentences.chinese: 筑蜂巢融合你琥珀幽香。

sentences.english: I forced suction aspiration nose, which started coming out of her sponsor flower.
sentences.chinese: 我用力吸吸鼻子，她的发端透出几缕幽香。

definition: to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
